medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 30 minutes after birth with hypoglycemia (20 mg/dl for Patient 1 and 26 mg/dl for Patient 2). Both patients experienced recurrent hypoglycemia episodes, leading to further diagnostic workups and treatments over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1: Asymptomatic cholelithiasis detected at age 2 years; homozygous for ABCC8 mutation. Patient 2: No known mutations identified; had episodes of hypotonia and cyanosis requiring glucose infusion.
medical_history.family_history: Patient 1: Healthy non-consanguineous Ashkenazi-Jewish parents; Patient 2: Unremarkable family history, except for a sister with cardiomyopathy.
